intro: Utricularia paulineae, commonly known as the Pauline's bladderwort, is a carnivorous plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is a small aquatic plant characterized by its tiny bladders used to trap prey. Native to the wetlands and marshes of Southeast Asia, it thrives in nutrient-poor water environments. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its unique adaptations for nutrient acquisition make it an interesting subject in botanical studies.
